intro: Stenospermation olgae, commonly known as the narrow-seed orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a unique type of seed capsule that is tightly sealed, making natural seed dispersal difficult. Its botanical significance lies in its specialized adaptations to its humid, shaded habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
